description.narrative:
The SIBC is the Oxfam’s global initiative, created to accelerate impact, understand needs of impact businesses and promote examplesof ‘Superstars’. This year, the competition has been implemented in 6 countries, including Somaliland, Egypt, Uganda, Nigeria, Cambodia, and Bolivia, with a focus on supporting business ideas that empower women and youths. In Cambodia, Oxfam integrates the SIBC into the newly introduced Program Impact-Driven SME (PrISME), a joint partnership with Oxfam, Khmer Enterprise, Platform Impact, and Cambodia Investors Club (CIC) to provide top-class advisory for business owners to scale impact businesses in Cambodia. We are working with the same implementing partners, Platform Impact and CIC to execute this project.
Founded in 2019, Platform Impact creates, develops and empowers Impact-Driven Enterprises aiming to overcome poverty, reduce inequalities and maximize improvements in human and environmental well-being in Cambodia and Southeast Asia. Locally, they have partnered with CIC, one of the biggest business associations in Cambodia with about 400+ members of which 25 percent are women entrepreneurs. Currently, via the PrISME, the team has expanded to include a number of Venture Builders, who have matching skills to support impact-driven enterprises to scale their impacts and be investment-ready. Working with Platform allows us to effectively and efficiently leverage their skillsets, resources and networks to deliver expected impacts of SIBC. Objectives of the Competition - Accelerate impact and create opportunities by supporting and promoting business ideas that focus on women and youth empowerment - Understand the needs of businesses in empowering women and youth and adapt our program accordingly - Stakeholders recognize the importance and potential of supporting and investing in impact businesses
Target Groups and Eligibility - Only SMEs participating in the Program Impact-Driven SME (PrISME) are invited to registerfor the competition. Benefits - The ‘Superstar’ winner will receive matching grants, plus tailored TA to support their implementation of the impact-focused innovation to further empower women and youths. Expected Deliverables Deliverable 1: A competition is launched. 2 (or 3) SMEs are selected as ‘Superstar’ winners. Deliverable 2: ‘Superstar’ winners receive the grant to implement the proposed idea for their business to become more inclusive. They will be supported and monitored to implement their innovation. Deliverable3: Stories (short videos or infographics) of ‘Superstar’ winners are developed and promoted as part of the influencing and communication strategy. Winners will have a chance to present their inclusive business idea in the existing workshop/policy event plan of PrISME. Deliverable 4: A final report containing details about the competition and implementation including financial expenditure willbe provided.

participating-org.narrative:
The organization is registered in Cambodia Platform Impact specialist’s Co., Ltd.is established as a Private Limited Company under the commercial laws of the Kingdom of Cambodia. Please find enclosed Platform Impact specialist’s Co., Ltd.’s: • Certificate of Incorporation • Tax Registration Card • 2019 Patent Tax - Goal, Vision, mission and value
Scaling economic, environmental and social impacts made by passionate and talented entrepreneurs with the capacity to lead on new directions in the sectors in which they operate. After working with International Development Organizations and the Private Sector in Asia for near twenty years our founders met in Cambodia. Passionate about the region and its people, they consistently confronted the challenge of “how to empower impact-driven enterprises to work hand in hand with local vulnerable communities, ensuring positive social and economic footprints and scale”.
Werealized that many impact-driven enterprises struggled to nurture a relationship withthe right investors or to draw complementary expertise into their core team. As a result, they were often unable to establish business models that would address complex and systemic issues encountered on the path to scale and success.
Paradoxically, investor appetite for impact investing and expertise in positive social development has never been stronger.
PLATFORM’ s unique approach combines development sector expertise and business acumen, with an in-depth understanding of sustainable finance andimpact investment markets.
System dynamic modelling allows us to go in depth in analysis and ensure that our projects are designed to deliver maximum benefits for our clients and the local communitiesthey serve. Our local and regional peer networks assist our clients building innovative partnerships across the private and public sectors.
In addition, we design and implement innovative impact measurement systems to track results for our clients in a transparent and highly reliable way.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security

description.narrative: Private sector actors have demonstrated alternative business practices that are fair and sustainable.
cases of businesses having improved corporate practices and using scorecards on societal and environmental value-add.
cases of design/refinement of (new) CSR standards designed/refined and their adoption by companies and financiers
cases of development and implementation of alternative business practices
cases of engagement of companies and financial institutions, (including MFIs) on business practices that are fair and sustainable
cases of small impact-driven businesses that run their businesses inclusive, fair and sustainable as example of the human economy
